ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Traumatic Sensorineural Hearing Loss (Cochlear Concussion)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of blunt trauma to the left ear followed by sudden hearing loss, consistent with cochlear damage given the sensorineural nature and normal middle ear function.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Functional Hearing Loss (Pseudohypacusis)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Considered due to pending litigation and financial incentive, but ruled out by the negative Stenger test results.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Ossicular Chain Discontinuity
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Possible after head trauma, but unlikely given the Type A tympanograms and lack of conductive component.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To establish hearing thresholds and type of loss following trauma.
To assess middle ear status and rule out conductive pathology like ossicular discontinuity.
To verify the organic nature of the unilateral hearing loss given the legal context.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Results indicate a moderate sensorineural hearing loss in the left ear and normal hearing in the right ear. Middle ear function is normal bilaterally. The negative Stenger test confirms the left-sided loss is organic.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear normal (PTA 3 dB HL); Left ear moderate SNHL (PTA 55 dB HL).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right WRS 100%; Left WRS 94% (masked), indicating good clarity.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Bilateral Type A, normal pressure and admittance.

proposed_items: Referral to Otolaryngologist for medical clearance
Amplification (Hearing Aid) for the left ear
Hearing protection devices (custom earplugs) for noise exposure
counseling_actions: Explain the nature of the traumatic hearing loss and its permanence
Discuss the validity of the test results (negative Stenger) in the context of the legal case
Counsel on the importance of protecting the 'good' right ear from loud music exposure
Discuss realistic expectations for amplification given the unilateral loss

escalation.rationale_short: To rule out other trauma-related complications (e.g., perilymph fistula, though less likely without dizziness) and provide medical clearance.

follow_up_plan.timeline: Annual or sooner if hearing changes
follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor hearing thresholds for stability and assess hearing aid benefit.

expected_outcome: Successful fitting of amplification for the left ear
Preservation of residual hearing through protection strategies
